resources.string: PyBot
FAQs
Do I need to be connected to Wifi in order for this app to work?
What cloud service does the app run on?
How does the app receive cloud messages?
How does the robot receive messages?
What does the red circle on the Homepage signify?
What does the green circle on the Homepage signify?
How do the voice commands work?
How can I find the recognized voice commands?
Where can I obtain more information?
Yes. The app uses a cloud server to retrieve gesture and voice commands that then get sent to the robot.
The cloud server that the app uses to retrieve data is Amazon Web Services (AWS).
The app uses Amazon Gateway Rest API paired with AmazonDB to retrieve the most recent gesture or voice command from the cloud.
The robot is connected over bluetooth to the app. It is sent the command through that communication pathway.

The red circle signifies the Robot is not connected to the Application via bluetooth. If this button appears, ensure the robot is powered and that check itâ€™s bluetooth connection. Also ensure bluetooth is on for the mobile device.
The green circle signifies the robot is accurately connected to the mobile application via bluetooth.

In order to execute a voice command use the Voice command button to begin recording. The system only recognizes one word commands. The recorded speech will be turned into text and the message will appear on the screen. If the speech is one of the recognized commands of the robot, the robot will execute a command a popup will come up showing the command the robot has just executed.
The recognized voice commands can be found by holding the voice icon on the Voice Commands page. The recognized voice commands are left, right, spin, back and forward.
To obtain more information regarding this project, please visit the Github page at: https://github.com/GestureRecognitionApplication/PyBot
